justification: The article states that in the economic choice task 'subjective value is measured though choice behavior' and describes rats choosing between pairs of food pellets presented on touch screens.
It notes that 'reinforcer devaluation, an iconic behavioral task to assess model-based inference… has shown repeatedly that OFC manipulations disrupt normal changes in behavior after devaluation.'
The authors report that in an odor sequence discrimination task 'task states … were also decodable independent of … value information,' demonstrating measurement of hidden state representations.

measured_by: face/house age-judgment switching task with 16 hidden states
justification: In the human fMRI study, 'These "hidden" states … were found to be uniquely decodable from BOLD signals in the OFC,' indicating the task measures internal state representations.
The text notes that 'OFC is required for outcome-specific Pavlovian-to-instrumental transfer,' referencing the PIT task as the behavioral measure.

It states that during sensory preconditioning, 'OFC has been found to acquire representations of sensory-sensory associations … during the initial phase of the task when two value-neutral sensory cues are paired,' using the preconditioning task to index this construct.
